dataIdInfo.idAbs:
GeMS-style geodatabases use _ID values as primary keys and ID values as foreign keys to tie various tables together. This script (re)generates _ID values while preserving any links established by existing _ID and ID values. As an option, GUIDs may be substituted for plain-text _ID and ID values.

This script modifies the input geodatabase. Make a backup copy before you run this script! See script Compact and Backup.

tool.name: SetIDvalues

param.name: Input_GeMS_style_geodatabase
param.dialogReference: The geodatabase for which _ID values are to be created or recreated. Must exist. May be file geodatabase (.gdb) or personal geodatabase (.mdb).

param.name: Use_GUIDs
param.dialogReference:
Default is unchecked (false),which creates _ID values as several characters which denote the table (e.g., MUP for MapUnitPolys) followed by consecutive zero-padded integers: MUP0001, MUP0002, MUP0003, etc.

If checked, creates GUIDs (Globally-Unique IDs which are many-byte nonsense strings) for _ID values.

param.name: Do_not_reset_DataSource_IDs
param.dialogReference:
If unchecked, resets values of DataSources_ID and all DataSourcesID, LocationSourceID, AnalysisSourceID and similar that refer to DataSources_ID.

Default is checked, which leaves these values unchanged.

tool.summary:
GeMS-style geodatabases use _ID values as primary keys and ID values as foreign keys to tie various tables together. This script (re)generates _ID values while preserving any links established by existing _ID and ID values. As an option, GUIDs may be substituted for plain-text _ID and ID values.

This script modifies the input geodatabase. Make a backup copy before you run this script! See script Compact and Backup.
